intro: Vernonia lambayequensis, commonly known as the Lambayeque vernonia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of northern Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. Its foliage is usually gray-green, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
